intro: Oenanthe ruwenzoriensis, commonly known as the Ruwenzori oenanthe, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of East Africa, particularly the Rwenzori Mountains. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in summer. Its leaves are typically pinnately divided, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Oenanthe ruwenzoriensis is adapted to high-altitude environments, showcasing resilience to cold and variable weather conditions.
